thread.title: To the Editor — All human beings matter and deserve respect
thread.title_full: To the Editor — All human beings matter and deserve respect

author: Contributed
title: To the Editor — All human beings matter and deserve respect
text:
Browse > Home / Letters to the Editor , Opinion / To the Editor — All human beings matter and deserve respect To the Editor — All human beings matter and deserve respect 
  Contributed 
NEW — 5:51 p.m. Oct. 23, 2015 
I just want to say I am not transgender however I stand for their rights and the rights of all others. I read the article in the Sammamish Review and was outraged to say the least when I saw this, and I quote, “I do not want to be showering with someone like that,” said one Sammamish resident in a call to the Sammamish Review. “I certainly don’t want my children or grandchildren exposed to that.” 
Typical response I would only expect out of the average Sammamish resident. Seriously?! I must say “that” is a human being with feelings and blood and a heart. So in dealing with this on a case-by-case basis I’m ashamed of you David Mayer. From my perspective I believe all lives matter and deserve the same respect. 
If this person who said these things doesn’t like it then she can take herself to another facility. I’ve been a resident of Sammamish for 10+ years and believe me, not by choice. If I had it any other way I would move away but unfortunately I’m stuck for the time being. 
I think what needs to be taught here is a lesson to all in tolerance. 
Julia A. Wallinger 
Written by Contributed · Filed Under Letters to the Editor , Opinion
